headline: Oracle (ORCL): Evaluating Valuation as Momentum Stalls and Investor Sentiment Shifts
summary: Oracle (ORCL) shares moved slightly in recent trading, capturing attention from investors as sentiment shifts around major tech names. The company’s performance this month shows mixed results, which encourages a closer evaluation of its longer-term track record and fundamentals. See our latest analysis for Oracle. Oracle’s recent share price dip, down 24.31% for the month despite being up 32.8% year-to-date, reflects shifting sentiment after a long stretch of impressive total shareholder...

headline: The AI Bubble May Have Already Popped. The Rally Can Still Survive.
summary: FEATURE  It wasn’t too long ago that the mere mention of “artificial intelligence” in a corporate press release would trigger an upside move for the stock.  Investors, eager to get ahead of the next wave of the new technology’s potential, were happy to believe in, and bet on, a bottom-line impact from AI deployment—even if it couldn’t be fully explained.

headline: Orca Security Now Available on Oracle Cloud Marketplace
summary: PORTLAND, Ore., November 19, 2025--Orca Security, a leading provider of agentless cloud security and an Oracle partner, today announced its Cloud Native Application Protection Platform (CNAPP) is available in Oracle Cloud Marketplace and can be deployed on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). Oracle Cloud Marketplace is a centralized repository of enterprise applications offered by Oracle and Oracle partners.

Oracle Cloud Marketplace is a centralized repository of enterprise applications offered by Oracle and Oracle partners.

headline: Oracle Named Overall Winner in Chartis RiskTech AI 50 2025 for Second Year
summary: Oracle Financial Services has been named the "Overall Winner" in the RiskTech AI 50 2025 report by Chartis Research for the second consecutive year. The global leader in risk technology research and analysis recognized Oracle as the top-ranking vendor among the 50 organizations evaluated and the leader in three of the four Chartis Category Awards, including innovation, strategy, and impact.

headline: Big 5 AI ‘hyperscalers’ have quadrupled their use of debt to fund operations, Bank of America says
summary: All five companies companies generate more than enough cash to cover their operations but the arrival of debt vehicles to fund AI has complicated the investment case for tech stocks.

headline: Rotation From Tech Leads Investors to Dividend-Paying Stocks
summary: The result is the first sustained selloff for the group since April, with the Nasdaq 100 leading the broader market lower as investors ditch tech winners in favor of more defensive stocks.  That group, which includes old-economy stalwarts like Exxon Mobil Corp., JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Procter & Gamble Co., is often coveted when riskier stocks start to look expensive.

headline: Paramount Is the Only Logical Winner in the Three-Horse Race for Warner
summary: HEARD ON THE STREET  “Top Gun Meets Harry Potter” might bomb as a pitch for a movie. As a deal pitch, though, it strangely works.  The famed Warner Bros. studio is officially on the block, as are HBO, CNN, Turner Broadcasting, DC Comics, the Discovery Channel and other businesses owned by Warner Bros Discovery   Just 3½ years old, the media conglomerate is holding an auction process with a deadline for the first round of nonbinding bids set for Thursday.

headline: Nvidia Takes On an Unfamiliar Role—Weighing Down the Stock Market
summary: Skepticism about the sustainability and payoff of artificial-intelligence investments has played a major role in the market's bleak mood this month.  Since Oct. 29, the day Nvidia shares hit their closing high, the AI chip giant's stock has fallen 12%.  An equal-weighted version of the S&P index—which adjusts for the massive market capitalizations of Nvidia and its big tech cohorts—is down only 2% over the same period.

headline: Should You Reassess Oracle After Its 24% Pullback Amid Cloud Partnership Buzz?
summary: Wondering if Oracle's recent share price moves have created a real bargain, or if you're catching a stock that's riding high? You're not alone; many investors are re-examining its value right now. The stock has seen plenty of action, with Oracle up 32.8% year-to-date, yet it's pulled back recently, dropping 24.3% over the past month. What's driving all the excitement and volatility? Recent news around major cloud partnerships and new product launches has grabbed investors' attention, fueling...
